fields.description:
I tried deleting a scaling group while logged into an AWS account while an instance was running.  I received this error: 'You cannot delete an AutoScalingGroup while there are scaling activities in progress for that group.'   The group doesn't get deleted so I try deleting it again and I get a delete successful  message but the group still shows on the list.  I have to refresh the page manually for the group to no longer show on the page.
eucaconsole.log:
{code}
2014-07-22 11:20:05 INFO ASIAJTT5...@AWS/us-west-1 [xiKnljjoJFs6Lnpf]: Creating scaling group sg1
2014-07-22 11:21:24 INFO ASIAJTT5...@AWS/us-west-1 [5Zr9nPhGa2BDHMV2]: Deleting scaling group sg1
2014-07-22 11:22:36 ERROR ASIAJTT5...@AWS/us-west-1 [5Zr9nPhGa2BDHMV2]: You cannot delete an AutoScalingGroup while there are scaling activities in progress for that group.
{code}
It appears as though the system times out waiting for the instance to terminate.  I've tried this same experiment using a Eucalyptus account and I cannot reproduce.
fields.summary: AWS delete scaling group generates error when scaling activities are in progress

comments.body: As I mentioned in the initial comment, this appears to be a timeout issue with the UI waiting for the instances to terminate.  The UI interface doesn't appear to be waiting long enough for the instances to terminate before it times out.

This is a known issue. AWS does not remove the scaling group immediately after the delete scaling group call is made. In case of running instances, the scaling group might stay around all the instances are fully terminated.

Not sure if there is API support for checking the status of the scaling group to discover if the delete has been initiated, but on our user console, it'd be possible to mark the scaling group to be "delete in progress" once the call is made and initiate the auto-refresh, similar to what happens on the instance landing page.
I see the issue now. It does appear that the server was trying to delete the scaling group before the instances were fully terminated.

And, also seeing the case where the scaling group's instance is stuck on "shutting down" state. This is a problematic case since the scaling group cannot be deleted if the instance does go to "terminated". It appears to be an issue on AWS.

Will further investigate on the frequency of such instances.

[~jloza] [~kgill] It was seen on AWS -- not sure if it's a recent event -- that shutting down instances take nearly 10 mins, going from shutting down to terminated. This means that we will need to reconsider how the delete scaling group operation is handled on our GUI.

Currently we wait about a minute and half for the instances to be terminated and make the delete scaling group calls. At which point an error would occur if there still exists instances in the shutting-down state. With the 10 mins wait time seen on AWS, the current process would never work since no user would sit around and wait 10 mins staring at the "Delete in progress" bar on the delete modal.

An alternative approach is to break down the delete scaling group operation into two steps:

1. provide the option of shutting down all instances and suspending the auto scaling process
2. when all instances are terminated, enable the option of deleting the scaling group

Please let us know what you think.

Kyo

I think we should push this out of 4.1 and consider alternatives for 4.2. It's not present on euca and so it's not release-critical IMO. 

Another thing we could do is when they ask to delete the scaling group, set the desired to 0 and wait the 10 mins, but that requires a background task queue. We need this for so many things, I think we should consider pushing for it in 4.2 on the back end so that we don't have to keep making UX compromises in the console and leaving things out that we need. [~kgill], thoughts on other ways to proceed?

Pull request is created for preventing the Internal server error occurrence:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1034

This is not a complete solution, so do not close the ticket. This issue has been moved to 4.2.

[~jloza]: I'm all for implementing a background task queue if we need it, but obtaining approval for the release team isn't going to be easy if the motivation here is to support a ~10min operation that is only required on the AWS side of the console.

Currently we have some arbitrary wait time set to be 3 mins for the instances to be fully terminated. This works for Eucalyptus in a small scale, but we can't be sure if this is scalable if the scaling group would contain a much larger  number of instances running. So, the review of the current delete scaling group would also be critical for Eucalyptus although it's only seen on AWS at the moment. In either case, the delete operation should just work regardless of how long it takes the instances to be terminated.
This ticket needs to move to 4.2, but there is no 4.2 release created yet.
PR that was merged should stay in 4.1, but the rest of the ticket should be targeted to 4.2 for a complete solution. Total fix too complicated for 4.1.

I can still reproduce this.  Exact same procedures to reproduce.

Perhaps we could run a check for the user when they click delete that checks for scaling activities in progress, and if there are some, present a nice dialog with a helpful error message telling them to wait a few minutes for scaling activities to complete and then retry.
